climbs.name: Sketches of Strain (AKA Spread and Butter)

content.description: This route has a wide variety of moves:  stemming, face climbing, and liebacks.  It is very well protected.
content.location: This is a thin, dark dihedral, down and right from Harvey's Bristol Creme.  It is on the south-facing formation.

climbs.name: Let's Get Physical
climbs.fa: Roger Linfield and Dennis Yates, Nov. 1986

content.description: Climb the obvious offwidth (crux).  It narrows to hand size and then ends, with an overhanging wall above.  Traverse left to Sketches and Strain and climb to the top.
content.protection: standard rack - there are narrow sections in the offwidth that take gear <4"
content.location: This climb is on the south-facing formation, starting just to the right of Sketches and Strain.

content.description: Jam up the left crack (offwidth for a few moves, narrowing to fists and then hands), using the thin right crack for protection.  Higher up, the left crack ends - climb the right crack which has now widened to hand size.  The crux exit follows a finger crack up and left.
content.location: This is one the east-facing formation.  It's a beautiful double crack on a smooth, flat, vertical wall.
